summary: The Accelerating Access to Dementia and Alzheimer’s Provider Training Act (AADAPT Act) amends the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the Project ECHO Grant Program. It establishes grants for eligible entities to develop and expand technology-enabled collaborative learning models focused on Alzheimer's disease and related dementias. The bill aims to improve healthcare provider retention, increase access to early and accurate diagnoses, and enhance the quality of dementia care. It defines eligible entities and healthcare professionals, outlines grant application requirements, specifies reporting obligations, and authorizes appropriations for the program.
